Payments to Poll Clerks
Staff employed in the preparation, maintenance & completion of official poll cards

Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the site shall be left in a condition that does not endanger the public or impair visual amenity.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a condition that does not endanger the public.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Any advertisement displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements, shall be maintained in a condition that does not impair the visual amenity.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a condition that does not endanger the public.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

No advertisement to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to -(a)	endanger persons using any highway, railway, waterway, dock, harbour or aerodrome (civil or military);(b)	obscure, or hinder the ready interpretation of, any traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air; or(c)	Hinder the operation of any device used for the purpose of security or surveillance or for measuring the speed of any vehicle.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The intensity of the illumination of the lighting permitted by this consent shall be no greater than 500 cd/sqm. Reason:  In the interests of amenity, the free flow of traffic on the highway and road safety in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The details submitted for Conditions 6 (Landscaping), 9 (Refuse Facilities) and 10 (Cycle parking) of Planning permission 15/15093/FUL by the applicant are considered satisfactory and these conditions are hereby fully discharged.Â
The Council's Tree and Landscaping Officer is satisfied with the information provided for Condition 6 (Landscaping) and recommended that the condition can be discharged.
Consultations: The Council's Biodiversity Officer, Environmental Protection Officer and Higways Officer were consulted. No objections raised.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Only two tree removals are listed requiring TPO consent. Their removals are justificed due to fungal decay rendering them unsafe.Recommendation:Approve with no replacement condition due to the trees being cut down to monolith to regenerate as heavy pollard rather than complete removal.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:A site visit was made on 04/07/2023 to assess whether the trees were visible to the public and contributing greatly enough to public amenity to be considered for a TPO, but due to the narrow field of view and that they were barely visible to the public even within this view due to being behind a larger and more prominant mature London Plane, they are not considered to be suiitable for the service of a TPO in this instance. The Council response should therefore default to one of 'No Objection'Recommendation:No Objections.
This is a duplicate application to 23/01808/DTN which has already been decided. It was accidentally created by the DM team a second time.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Urgent works for health and safety within a high target area in Canbury Park Gardens.Recommendation:Approve.
